meanings.definition: A soft metal alloy used for bearings.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the worn-out bearings with babbitt to make the machine run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The factory ordered a new batch of babbitt for the production line.
meanings.sent3: The babbitt gleamed in the sunlight, making the machinery look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The babbitt acted as a gentle cushion, preventing friction and wear in the engine.
meanings.sent5: The babbitt's silvery sheen caught the eye of the curious onlookers.

meanings.definition: To line or coat with babbitt metal.
meanings.sent1: The skilled technician babbitted the engine parts expertly for optimal performance.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to babbitt the bearings to ensure they function smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic joked that he could babbitt anything, even a toaster!
meanings.sent4: She babbitted the gears with precision, like an artist painting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The process of babbitting the components added a layer of protection against wear and tear.

meanings.definition: A person who conforms unthinkingly to middle-class ideals.
meanings.sent1: He was often referred to as a babbitt because of his obsession with material possessions.
meanings.sent2: The novel's protagonist was portrayed as a babbitt who valued social status above all else.
meanings.sent3: The babbitt in the story comically insisted on mowing his lawn at the same time every Sunday.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a babbitt trapped in a cycle of societal expectations and norms.
meanings.sent5: The babbitt's narrow-mindedness was evident in his refusal to try new things.
